definition: to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)

sentences.english: This watchfulness was not long without reward.
sentences.chinese: 這種警惕並非長久沒有報償的。

sentences.english: Seller shall not be entitled to compensation for cancelled non-custom Goods.
sentences.chinese: 賣主不會有資格獲得對被取消的非風俗物品的報償。

sentences.english: In Milton's case this investment in power paid off.
sentences.chinese: 米爾頓對力量的投資獲得了報償。

sentences.english: If I die what will be my reward?
sentences.chinese: 倘我死去，能有什麼報償？

sentences.english: Are we rewarded for our virtue and for our virtuous deeds?
sentences.chinese: 我們會因爲貞操以及貞操的德行得到報償麼？

sentences.english: Keep up your good work and your efforts will be re- warded .
sentences.chinese: 繼續好好的工作，你的努力將會得到報償。

sentences.english: You have acted nobly, and deserve a recompense.
sentences.chinese: 你品格高尚，該得到相應的報償。

sentences.english: The compensations of such religion are denied wolf larsen .
sentences.chinese: 海狼賴生得不到這種宗教的報償。

definition: to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
